headline.main: MISS BOURKE-WHITE PRAISES STALIN; Back After Photographing Him in Moscow, She Says He Has Extraordinary Personality

lead_paragraph: Erskine Caldwell, novelist, and his wife, Margaret Bourke-White, photographer, returned to New York yesterday aboard the Pan American Airways' Atlantic Clipper after five months in Russia. They expressed the opinion that "we will all be helling' Hitler within the next eighteen months" unless all-out aid is given the Soviet Union.
abstract: E Caldwell and M Bourke-White laud Stalin and USSR resistance; illus
